alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 12:49PM EDT until June 16 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Central Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 1249 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Wissinoming, Tacony, Holmesburg, Northeast Philadelphia, Kensington, Center City, Ben Franklin Bridge, Feasterville-Trevose, Feasterville, and Pennsauken. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 349 and 352. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 20 and 28. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 344. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
